TopicTitle: [11/26/15 Update] Say Hello to the Light-Green Group!

Articles.Content:
I'm glad to be mentioned in the list. After all, moderators often don't have happy things to share

Welcome to the group, Nova & Upsilon!
Maybe one day
#9, really? That's a lot higher than I expected.

Here's my mandatory acknowledgment of this post.

Very glad to be included here. Does this mean I'm famous?
i'd be interested in a rep/post stat

So is rank on the list based upon the amount of rep you have? For instance Giggleplex has even MORE green on his rep bar.

EDIT: Well looks like I forgot to read. (The answer is yes)

That and a can of WD-40 will solve all engineering problems.

-snip-

Dang, now I really wish my rep bar said I had both and then never ever changed.
I feel like this would be best suited to General KSP discussion. It's intended for Newbies as well as veterans, and newbies rarely ever check down here.

I feel like this would be best suited to General KSP discussion. It's intended for Newbies as well as veterans, and newbies rarely ever check down here.

I actually agree with GregroxMun here. This thread seems to be more suited to General KSP discussion, after all. If some friendly mod could please move it back I would appreciate it very much.

I'm....

kinda...

there... ish...?

I am pleased to be counted in such esteemed company. It is a bit confusing to me that I have received so much rep, most if not all of the people below me on that list have contributed far more to the community than I have, whether through developing amazing mods, completing awesome missions, sharing wonderful designs, helping keep the forums on the rails, or making videos, images and written content both enlightening and entertaining. I'm just a wisecracker with an opinion about everything.
I have so much rep my counter could not handle all the jazz and started over.

Well if anyone fancied giving me some rep I`d not complain. I`m half way there.

Sometimes I do a round of splashing the rep out `just because` to people I see regularly...

Wow I'm in the top ten!

Thank you to all who gave me rep! It really makes sharing feel worthwhile knowing people enjoy your work.

And thanks OP for starting this. Its very interesting.

MJ

Top ten, that is pretty cool. Thanks for you nice words.

I do think it is a good idea, rather than just listing names with no info.

I do sometimes wonder if there is a correlation between rep level and number of posts- the more active you are, the more likely you are to have done something rep worthy. I know there's a couple of things I tend to give it for- inspirational craft design, informative analyses, enjoyable fan work things, or being helpful.

Or, occasionally, because I think that person is awesome, and if the rep bar is supposed to mean something, they should have more. Though I would probably feel weird, getting some just randomly like that...

Edited October 7, 2014 by Tw1

I do sometimes wonder if there is a correlation between rep level and number of posts- the more active you are, the more likely you are to have done something rep worthy.

You can see a sorted list beside post count here. I think of rep/postcount as a better measure than rep alone, on the first page there you can see Majorjim, Xacktar and Overfloater managed to get their light green bars with fewer than 1000 posts. Not sure about Cap't Skunky, he may have had rep added by the system where he was community manager when it was implemented, similar to the Squad account.
Cap't Skunky probably shouldn't be on the list, I think. He's not a member of the KSP community at all.

Man I lurked when skunky was here, good times. guy has an amazing rep/post ratio.

also, I am on my way to this magical light green land....

EDIT: 60th...this will never do. ill have to be more obsequious...

Edited October 9, 2014 by r4pt0r

Man I lurked when skunky was here, good times. guy has an amazing rep/post ratio.

also, I am on my way to this magical light green land....

I remember when you had that cat siggie and 2 rep bars...

Damn. r4pt0r has been here shorter than I have and he/she has twice as much rep... alaska of relevant

I knew I had collected a lot of reputation points, but I had never expected to be number 18 on the entire forum. And as recently as January, I only had a single bar.

Thanks for the kind words, and to everyone who has commented on my little creations. This made my day.

Updated the Light-Green Group. It's actually amazing how much change there was compared to only a week ago. There's a new member of the Group now, as well: TriggerAu. Welcome!

A few notes:

I know that some of the people mentioned may have had their Rep count artificially boosted (SQUAD and Cap'n Skunky). However, this isn't really a competition, and both of the people with boosted reputations contributed enormously to the actual game. Thus, I'm keeping them in the OP.

Some people have suggested that I include a +Rep to post ratio. I don't really have a problem with this, except for the fact that I would have to hand-edit this ratio more often than once a week for it to be even vaguely accurate. I wish I had the time for that... and I may in a little while. However, for the time being, I'm not going to include it yet.

...and I still think that this might be of more help to new Forum-goers (and more seasoned Forumers alike) to be in the General Discussion... if a mod could move it back (or give me a fair reason that it's currently in Kerbal Network), that would be great. Thanks.

Cap't Skunky probably shouldn't be on the list, I think. He's not a member of the KSP community at all.

This hadn't happened when you wrote that, but the good Cap't was recently sighted.

Looks like I'm the newest member of the... um... 5 rep bar club! I think I'll be a light green soon .

This hadn't happened when you wrote that, but the good Cap't was recently sighted.

Wait what?! 0: And he got his avatar back too!

Edited October 14, 2014 by RocketPilot573

What? Awesome!

Edit: I viewed his member page to see if he had any other posts and it seems to be messed up. formatting is all off and his last post doesn't appear.

Hey um, I think you need to remove what you said about Capn Skunky leaving. He posted in SQUADS latest article about .90 yesterday. It's on page 5 of comments. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content/313-Beta-Than-Ever-The-Future-of-KSP?page=5#comments

EDIT: Just now saw Red Iron's post, but still. He is back and has posted twice. He's alive!
